front.title: Maximally Redundant Trees in Segment Routing

abstract.t: This document presents a Fast Reroute (FRR) approach aimed at providing link and node protection of node and adjacency segments within the Segment Routing (SR) framework based on Maximally Redundant Trees (MRT) FRR algorithm [RFC 7811]. Fast-Reroute with Maximally Redundant Trees (MRT-FRR) for Segment routing network is to provide link-protection and node- protection with 100% coverage in Segment routing network topology that is still connected after the failure. MRT is computational efficient.
